```{r, message=FALSE}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
data('mtcars')
```

Now, some summary stats. Mostly one big table:

```{r}
summary(mtcars)
```

And this is the part where I try out a plot:

```{r}
mtcars %>% ggplot(aes(x = mpg, y = hp, color = as.factor(gear))) + geom_point()
```

But also, an interactive plot:

```{r, message=FALSE}
library(plotly)
data('iris')
iris %>% plot_ly(x = ~Sepal.Length, y = ~Sepal.Width, frame= ~Species, type = 'scatter', mode = 'markers')

```
